lexUnit.name: reassure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: allay the doubts and fears of

sentence.text: Neither did the DFR reassure the bank that it would have an adequate security interest in the document representing the goods .
I always wrote the replies and told him the news and reassured him that Mum was watching his widow , which it gave her great pleasure to do .
The first reaction is to reassure Mr Gorbachev that there was no bold US ambition to take strategic advantage of the collapse of Moscow 's empire .
Can I honestly reassure her that she will come to no harm in pursuing this phenomenon ?
Mr Talabani is said to have reassured his hosts that autonomy was the limit of his ambitions .
Councillor Joan Wade , of Stockton Borough Council , said she wanted to reassure senior citizens in the Stockton area that they can still use their passes to get to Langburgh .
In the morning , Jack related his experience to his wife who listened sympathetically but reassured him that it must have been a nightmare .
However , on his belated homecomings , he indirectly reassured her that the needed person did return m- the end .
I wish to reassure Andrew Allan and Andrew T Forsyth that our trial was indeed prospective .
He reassured Reed about local assistance .
While the Secretary of State has tried to assure the House about the problems and implications of recognition of Croatia , will he try once more to reassure us about that recognition ?
Gorbachev himself tried to reassure West Europeans about his intentions by developing the idea of a ` common European house " .
Later Sarah and her mother came to see Julia , and she told them that Joe was at Dover and Anne had written to reassure him about them .
THE head of County Durham 's ambulance services yesterday attempted to reassure health watchdogs about the level of cover in Upper Teesdale .
It was Ceauşescu who reassured Sadat with positive answers to his key questions : Could he trust Menachem Begin and could Begin deliver on any promises he might make to Egypt ?
You may find that older dogs are nervous under these circumstances , if they have never been on a train or bus before , and you should always try to reassure them with your tone of voice .
Then I had to reassure her that we were ` just having fun " .
` Computers will never replace executives , " Robert Lucky reassured them .
` No , it 's all right , Mum , " Rachel hastened to reassure her .
` Oh , you need n't worry about them , " the Doctor reassured her overconfidently .
